title: Adapter-node creates double slash in manifest.js file paths when building

milestone.description: stuff we need to nail down before launch

body:
### Describe the bug

https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/master/packages/adapter-node/index.js#L50 sets the relative path to `'./'` which is then prepended to the list of manifest.js files

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78720069/201675358-3d4ce04d-5223-4699-9e23-5fc7b06c4afc.png)

This leads to errors during building like the following

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78720069/201675569-518a9461-c85d-4a19-8829-74cfa3def332.png)

I have seen weird behaviour, as building on windows appears to be ok, but linux and github CI both crash 

### Reproduction

1. `npm create svelte@latest my-app`
2. choose all defaults
3. `cd my-app`
4. `npm i -D @sveltejs/adapter-node`
5. `npm install`
6. Then change svelte.config.js from `adapter-auto` to `adapter-node`
7. `npm run build`
8. inspect `.svelte-kit/adapter-node/manifest.js`

### Logs

```Shell

error during build:

    at ModuleLoader.handleResolveId (file:///SolutionFolder/node_modules/rollup/dist/es/shared/rollup.js:22156:24)
    at ModuleLoader.resolveDynamicImport (file:///SolutionFolder/node_modules/rollup/dist/es/shared/rollup.js:22210:120)

Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```
